general.headline: Principal Technologist - STELaRLab at Lockheed Martin Australia
general.description:
I am an experienced technical and program leader with a proven track record in software and system  architecture and design. The programs I am involved with use a variety of delivery strategies from traditional processes such a as functional requirements analysis, validation and development through to more modern agile methods where appropriate.

I have extensive extensive experience in all aspects of Geospatial application use and development and am a strong supporter and user of OGC Geospatial standards in my work. Recently this has extended to the  development of guidelines for Earth Observation data and implementing processing systems. I also have a good working knowledge of Remote Sensing science and related technology. In addition to these geospatial activities, I also participate in Industry development programs through related professional organisations. 

I have worked in a variety of industries and technology fields including software product development, engineering simulation, Defence geospatial solutions, high performance computing and as a technology lead for many research and development programs. I have been fortunate in my career to be able to take several concept and ideas for products and develop them to commercial quality applications and results.

In addition to my professional programming career I also enjoy developing analysis for strategic direction setting and assessing new and exciting technologies. 

My professional goals are to
- create relevant useful software applications.
- work in creative teams to meet new challenges.
- work closely with clients to achieve the best possible outcomes.
- engage in hi-tech science and technology projects.

I am supported in my work by my personal values: respect for others, getting the right outcomes for clients and partners and extending my knowledge and learning to new fields.

My current interests include android programming, natural language processing and Quantum Computing.

jobs.description:
As the Principal Technologist of Lockheed Martin Science, Technology, Engineering Leadership and Research Laboratory (STELaRLaB) my role is to develop and execute a portfolio of information based projects utilising Machine Learning, AI techniques, Geospatial Intelligence, C4ISR algorithm development system and autonomy research.  In addition to the to "information based" projects STELaRLab also undertakes research in various fields relevant to the Defence and National Security domains.

STELaRLab is Lockheed Martin's first Multi disciplinary and cross business area research and development  facility outside the United States.

My tasks at Lockheed Martin include 
1) Project Lead for the “Unlocking the LANDSAT Archive” Program sponsored by the Australian Space Research program. This program deals with the processing of Australia's archive of LANDSAT data    using HPC resources and making it available to the public as a calibrated dataset. This program is a joint program between Geoscience Australia, VPAC, CRC for Spatial information and ANU National Compute Infrastructure. This project is a Big Data project and we have developed a comprehensive approach to create a system for the future needs of Australia's earth observation community.
2) The design and development Geospatial and data indexing solutions for Defence.
3) Managing the Swift Lab (C4ISR) in Melbourne including dealing with diverse technology sets, ITAR issues and audits as well as customer demonstrations of integrated systems.
4) Managing R&D to support future work and development of staff
5) Supporting Business Development with technical proposal development

Lockheed Martin

As a board member of SIBA National I am making a contribution back to an industry
      
      that I consider has great strategic value to our economy and national security.

Amod has worked on software development and implementations, both in Australia and overseas, and is experienced in the successful delivery of projects in the telecommunications, insurance and other large and medium sized corporations.

His knowledge and experience in IT development and implementation, gives him the ability to add value to projects, not only through his diligent application of project management methodologies, but through his ability to perceive the larger picture of the business environment.

The Scope of the assignment was to provide project management support for Realtime TR2.2 & 2.3, including, project meeting management, change management, financial management, and reporting and document management. In addition to this, Amod was responsible for creating and maintaining the project status on various Telstra Project Management systems which includes Finance system (Integral), Project Tracking system (EPM - Clarity), Change Management system (TICR) and Document Management system (DME). He was also responsible for creating and maintaining various project artefacts like Project Management Plan, Communication Plan and Project Schedule. 

Amod was able to ensure the timely delivery of the project artefacts to achieve the project milestones. His ability to do multiple tasks and flexibility to take up various roles helped the project to keep the balance between resources and workload.

Amod lead the team responsible for the management and support of development and enhancement for these systems. He performed all the project management functions and was an interface between the development team, the business and higher management. Amod developed and maintained the project schedules for each piece of work, as well as allocating and monitoring tasks of each team member. general.headline: Research Engineer at STELaRLab
general.description:
Rubayet-E-Azim
Current Position: Research Engineer, STELaRLab, Lockheed Martin.

Rubayet-E-Azim Anee has previously worked as a Postdoctoral Researcher in MMARS Laboratory in Monash University, Clayton, Australia. She was a postgraduate intern in Lockheed Martin, Australia. She developed a Machine Learning technique for multi-dimensional classification problems. She has completed her PhD from MMARS group in Monash University and worked on Chipless RFID technology. Her PhD thesis is titled as 'Collision, Data Recovery and Localisation for Chipless RFID'. She completed her bachelor in Electrical and Electronic Engineering in 2009 from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET), Dhaka Bangladesh. She worked as a lecturer in Presidency University, Dhaka Bangladesh from 2009 to 2010.

jobs.description:
Project 1: "Smart Shopping Trolley using Chipless RFID"
Customers can get excellent shopping experience is an RFID system based cloud computing interface is possible to installed. A chipless RFID enabled smart shopping trolley is proposed. The trolley is retrofitted with a chipless RFID tag reader. The items tagged with fully printable chipless RFID tag are scanned with the reader and recorded in the electronic list. The payment will be automated with cloud computing interfaced with the central database.

Project 2: "Wireless Power Pole Health Monitoring for Smart Grid"
A new smart sensing system for power pole health monitoring method is proposed. Instead of manual invasive and non-invasive pole heath monitoring methods, the proposed system provides a wireless monitoring of pole-health with the minimal of human intervention. Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) sensors are installed on the pole and mobile readers mounted on a vehicle or a garbage trucks receive the health monitoring information from the sensors. The collected data is send to the central database system (SCADA) via Wi-Fi (when possible) or cloud computing. This approach has the prospect of good management of power assets and equipment and shall save hundreds of dollars in the operation budget of utility companies.

- Implementation of and  testing of machine learning techniques suitable for multi-dimensional classification problem.
- The problem entails mapping probable paths for objects based on an initial classification type and then working to produce a probabilistic model via machine learning to use as a component for a control system.
- Working with Python, Keras, Tensorflow, Theano, Scikitlearn.
-Implementation of neural network for image segmentation and classification.

**As a MITI project participant Anee has tested and reviewed the quality of segmentation of aerial images as well as the scalability of AI for image processing using combination of python software such as Keras, Tensorflow and Caffe.

Thesis Title:
"Collision, Data Recovery and Localisation in Chipless RFID" 

It presents new signal processing algorithms for collision detection and localisation of chipless RFID tags. To mitigate collision, three algorithms have been developed and verified through simulation and laboratory experiments. They include: (i) Fractional Domain Analysis (FrFT), (ii) CW Radar technique (FMCW) and (iii) Resonance localisation in time-frequency plane. A novel localisation method based on trilateration and linear Least Square Approximation is also presented. This method uses a unique signal conditioning method to locate the tag position in the interrogation zone. The combination of the algorithms are aimed to be implemented in the digital section of the reader to improve the efficacy of the chipless RFID system.

jobs.description:
Master every turn with Carrera.

We’re fearless in ensuring every significant, professional turn you make contributes to a more fulfilling life.

With several of our consultants having worked in sales and marketing roles, we know what it takes to succeed in your world.

We are dedicated to providing our clients and candidates with the highest levels of service, tailored solutions and advice across a range of industries to create more meaningful career journeys.

Renowned for our approachability, all our business activity is conducted with respect, integrity and a down-to-earth sincerity, while our flexible and consultative approach to your needs is always driven to deliver a positive outcome.

With offices in Sydney and Brisbane and a national presence and capability; we have links with many of the best known companies and most sought-after candidates in the country. Let us help you master every turn.

We spend more than $500 million annually on discovery and development of new, innovative, environmentally sustainable solutions for weed, insect and fungal diseases in crops and pastures. Across Australia and New Zealand, Dow AgroSciences operate three research stations that are part of a global network and are critical components in the product development life cycle.

There are six global agricultural research and development (R&D) companies with the capability and capacity to bring a new product into the marketplace and provide ongoing stewardship for those products. Product stewardship is important to Dow AgroSciences and almost 40 per cent of Dow AgroSciences R&D budget is directed to support existing products.

Royal Philips of the Netherlands is a leading health technology company focused on improving people’s health and enabling better outcomes across the health continuum from healthy living and prevention, to diagnosis, treatment and home care. Philips leverages advanced technology and deep clinical and consumer insights to deliver integrated solutions. The company is a leader in diagnostic imaging, image-guided therapy, patient monitoring and health informatics, as well as in consumer health and home care.

PLP Group (Pty) Ltd is a diversified services company that provides brand enhancement and stakeholder engagement solutions to clients across Africa and the rest of the world.

We’ve been around since 1992, and have established ourselves as the go-to solution provider for customer and employee lifestyle programmes, business process outsourcing, sales, SME solutions and marketing.

We partner with our clients to provide brand defining products and services that help them build and grow their business.

By the end of 2015 PLP will have independently owned operations in 23 African countries, while we have had a service footprint in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Europe, Australia, New Zealand and the Middle East, since 1 September 2014. In conjunction with our service partners in these countries, we provide extensive international services to our local and African customers.

Innovators in customer and staff acquisition and retention. People-centred. Technology backed. Bringing you quantifiable results.

Cross Fire Management (Pty) Ltd was established by John Cross in 1990 in Johannesburg, South Africa. At the time, John, who had gained a reputation as a professional in his field with previously established fire protection companies, felt that the stage was right to start his own business with new ideas and innovations and would no longer be restricted by ''old school'' ideologies.
 
The company's initial philosophy of quality over quantity ensured that it soon became the market leader in the fire protection trade for small-work type projects such as revamps, extensions, and to a large extent, servicing and maintenance, as well as emergency repair work.
 
The company's success in this direction steadily led to further growth and expansion of the business in order to meet ever increasing customer and client requirements and demands

general.headline: Collaborator | Problem Solver | Change Agent
general.description:
After leaving High School, I postponed my University Studies for 12 months and decided to take the time to gain some commercial experience. Having possessed book keeping and office exposure, it made sense to work as an Office Administrator. I was fortunate to partner with new management to implement new software and processes to streamline the business, supporting its growth into new markets. 

Turns out I have a knack for solving problems and delivering change management initiatives. I have since utilised this experience in a range of industries including Travel and Tourism, Construction, Retail and Manufacturing, both locally and globally. 

Spending time in the UK enabled me to adapt quickly to  new environments, different cultures and leverage off my organisational efficiency skills to help deliver business improvement projects. This led me to successfully manage an organisations structural changes, develop new processes, acquire top talent and collaborate with staff to build a strong team environment. 

I genuinely enjoy building relationships with stakeholders at all levels, across a range of industries. I thrive in resolving challenges and don’t mind getting my hands dirty. 

I’m always open to connect with like-minded individuals. Feel free to contact me at: april.lightbody@gmail.com
